block.p: Carlyn LaRue Henry and Michael David Mandelbaum were married last evening at the Rough Creek Lodge in Glen Rose, Tex. The Rev. Michael G. Wallens, an Episcopal priest, performed a ceremony that combined Episcopal and Jewish traditions.
The bride, 29, is a recruiter in New York for the Oxbridge Group, an executive search firm. She graduated from Wesleyan University. She is a daughter of Rue Howell Henry and Gray G. Henry of Dallas.

Carlyn LaRue Henry and Michael David Mandelbaum were married last evening at the Rough Creek Lodge in Glen Rose, Tex. The Rev. Michael G. Wallens, an Episcopal priest, performed a ceremony that combined Episcopal and Jewish traditions.
The bride, 29, is a recruiter in New York for the Oxbridge Group, an executive search firm. She graduated from Wesleyan University. She is a daughter of Rue Howell Henry and Gray G. Henry of Dallas.

The bridegroom, 33, is the general manager of the New York office of Connors Communications, a public relations and marketing concern. He graduated from Tufts University and Brooklyn Law School. He is a son of Mercy and Ronald Mandelbaum of Coronado, Calif.
